author: Miranda Nazzaro
description: Messaging app WhatsApp has been banned on congressional staffers’ government devices, the U.S. House’s chief administrative officer (CAO) confirmed Monday. “Protecting the People’s House is our topmost priority, and we are always monitoring and analyzing for potential cybersecurity risks that could endanger the data of House Members and staff,” said Chief Administrative Officer Catherine Szpindo…
title: WhatsApp banned on House staffer devices

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: The Senate parliamentarian has rejected several controversial provisions in the GOP’s ‘big beautiful bill’ over the last few days. Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) aims to have the bill on President Trump’s desk by July 4. But first, some of the megabill’s most controversial aspects must undergo the so-called “Byrd bath,” meaning they aren’t…
title: Here’s what the Senate parliamentarian has struck from Trump’s megabill

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Jim Himes (D-Conn.) said Monday that Iran targeting U.S. military bases “is hopefully performative” in the wake of U.S. strikes against the Middle Eastern country. “We are in this snowball that is going downhill that nobody really controls,” Himes told MSNBC’s Chris Jansing.  “Now, I completely agree with your military expert. Hopefully, this is…
title: House Democrat on Iran targeting US bases: ‘Hopefully, this is performative’

author: Megan Mueller
description: The Missouri Department of Transportation says it never truly knows when or where a pavement buckle may occur.
title: WATCH: Car goes airborne as road buckles under intense heat in Missouri

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: The Supreme Court on Monday lifted judge-imposed limits on the Trump administration’s deportations to countries where migrants have no ties over a scathing dissent from the court’s liberal justices. The administration warned U.S. District Judge Brian Murphy’s injunction was endangering immigration officials stuck in Djibouti guarding a group of convicted criminals, who were destined for South…
title: Supreme Court lifts third country deportation limits; liberals pen scathing dissent

author: Julia Mueller
description: Former President Biden’s White House doctor, Kevin O’Connor, is set to appear for a deposition before the House Oversight and Government Reform Committee next month, a committee spokesperson confirmed to The Hill.  O’Connor is scheduled to be deposed on July 9 as committee Chair Rep. James Comer (R-Ky.) expands his panel’s probes into Biden’s mental…
title: Biden’s White House physician to appear before House panel

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Monday responded to Iran’s attack on the Al Udeid U.S. Air Force base in Qatar, calling Tehran’s retaliation “weak” before urging for “Peace and Harmony,” including with Israel. “Iran has officially responded to our Obliteration of their Nuclear Facilities with a very weak response, which we expected, and have very effectively countered.…
title: Trump urges Iran, Israel to seek ‘Peace and Harmony’ after ‘weak’ Qatar strike

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: The Iranian government confirmed the airstrikes on the Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar on Monday, saying it “smashed” U.S. forces to retaliate against the U.S. strikes on its nuclear sites. “The Secretariat of the Supreme National Security Council announced that in response to the aggressive and brazen action of the United States against Iran’s…
title: Iran says it ‘smashed’ Al Udeid to retaliate for ‘brazen’ US attack

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Iran launched an attack on the Al Udeid U.S. Air Force base in Qatar on Monday, as the world awaited its retaliation following U.S. strikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities over the weekend. The attack marked another escalation in the ongoing Middle Eastern conflict, which Israel launched with airstrikes against Iran on June 13. Here’s…
title: What to know about Iran target: US air base Al Udeid

author: Tara Suter
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday took aim at the recent U.S. strikes on Iran, calling them a “completely unprovoked act of aggression.” “You are visiting Russia during a challenging period, marked by a significant escalation of tensions both in the region and surrounding your country,” Putin told Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi, according to…
title: Putin: ‘Unprovoked act of aggression’ against Iran ‘without foundation or justification’

author: Laura Kelly
description: Exiled from Iran for more than 40 years, Iranian crown prince Reza Pahlavi, the son of the country’s deposed Shah, on Monday offered to lead Iran’s transition to democracy after regime change.  Pahlavi held a press conference Monday in Paris amid spiraling tensions in the Middle East, as Iran launched retaliatory strikes against U.S. assets…
title: Exiled son of last shah offers to serve as interim Iran leader

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The U.S. military strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, including Fordow, Isfahan and Natanz, have caused significant damage, but the IAEA is waiting for a cessation of hostilities to assess the full extent of the damage.
title: UN nuclear agency chief: Fordow likely sustained ‘very significant damage’

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: Florida Attorney General James Uthmeier (R) asked the Supreme Court on Monday to allow the state to enforce its new immigration law as an appeal plays out in a lower court.  The new law, SB 4-C, makes it a state crime for people to enter Florida after arriving in the U.S. illegally and evading immigration…
title: Florida AG asks Supreme Court to pave way for new immigration law

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Monday lashed out at the media as journalists reported on the uncertainty around the extent of destruction at Iranian nuclear facilities targeted by U.S. strikes over the weekend. Trump blasted reporters and executives at CNN, ABC News and NBC News in the aftermath of the U.S. strikes. Multiple news outlets have reported…
title: Trump knocks ‘sleazebag’ journalists over Iran strikes: ‘Everyone knows’ sites ‘totally destroyed’

author: Gerry Petrella, opinion contributor
description: AI can help reduce traffic fatalities by enabling real-time traffic analysis, preventing collisions, and optimizing emergency response, and Congress should consider incorporating digital infrastructure and AI technologies into existing federal transportation planning, funding and research programs.
title: Everyone hates traffic. Let’s use AI to fix it.

author: Former Rep. Mark Meadows (R-N.C.), opinion contributor
description: President Trump has reaffirmed his commitment to putting American manufacturing workers first by increasing tariffs on Canadian aluminum and steel, while globalist special interest groups are opposing the move, but the president is fighting for American workers and their future.
title: Trump’s 50 percent aluminum, steel tariffs will create new American manufacturing jobs

author: Julia Shapero
description: Sen. Adam Schiff (D-Calif.) introduced legislation Monday seeking to bar public officials, including the president and his family, from certain cryptocurrency-related activities amid growing concerns about President Trump’s involvement in the industry.  The Curbing Officials’ Income and Nondisclosure (COIN) Act would prohibit the president, vice president, high-ranking executive branch employees, special government employees and members…
title: Schiff unveils presidential crypto ban legislation

description: Attorney General Pam Bondi is scheduled to appear before a House Appropriations Committee hearing on Monday afternoon. The attorney general is expected to face questions on the Department of Justice budget request for fiscal 2026. Watch the hearing, scheduled to begin at 2 p.m. EDT, in the video player above.
title: Watch live: Bondi questioned at House hearing

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Sen. Rand Paul (R-Ky.), who has clashed with President Trump over tariffs and raising the debt limit, is now taking aim at Trump’s preemptive strikes against Iran, declaring that Congress, not the president, “holds the war-power.” “We must not forget Congress holds the war-power. If we don’t our nation drifts further from both liberty and…
title: Rand Paul: We must not forget Congress holds the war-power

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: More women were able to access abortion care in 2024 than the previous year despite state bans, reflecting a continued increase in the three years since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade, according to a report issued Monday.  The latest report from the #WeCount project of the Society of Family Planning, which supports abortion…
title: Abortions continued rising in 2024 despite state bans: report

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Qatari officials temporarily closed the nation’s airspace on Monday as Iran threatens to retaliate for U.S. strikes on three of its nuclear sites this past weekend. “The competent Qatari authorities announce the temporary suspension of air traffic in the country’s airspace out of concern for the safety of citizens, residents, and visitors,” Qatar’s ministry of…
title: Qatar closes airspace as Iran threatens US retaliation

author: Al Weaver
description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) announced on Monday that the upper chamber will remain in Washington until it is able to pass President Trump’s ambitious tax cut package, raising the chances of scuttling a planned recess next week. “Senators return to Washington today and we will remain here until this reconciliation bill is passed,”…
title: Thune: Senate to remain in Washington until tax package is passed

author: Colin Meyn
description: President Trump on Monday blasted former Russian President Dmitry Medvedev over remarks suggesting Iran’s allies could supply it with nuclear warheads as Tehran promises to retaliate for U.S. strikes on its nuclear facilities.  “The enrichment of nuclear material — and, now we can say it outright, the future production of nuclear weapons — will continue,”…
title: Trump rips Russia’s Medvedev over nuclear remarks

author: Imran Khalid, opinion contributor
description: The U.S. economy is running on fumes, with tariffs, monetary policy indecision, and fiscal incoherence creating a combustible cocktail that could lead to a slow-motion unmooring of confidence in the coherence of U.S. economic stewardship.
title: Trust deficit: Global markets are losing faith in the US

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) said on Monday he thinks Democrats are wrong to oppose the U.S. strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities but said it wouldn’t be the first time he disagreed with the party consensus on a controversial issue. In an interview on Fox News Channel’s “America’s Newsroom,” Fetterman said he expects some members of…
title: Fetterman on Democrats criticizing Iran strikes: ‘Our party has been often wrong’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: The Israel Defense Forces have issued a warning to residents of Tehran to evacuate the area due to ongoing military strikes against Iran's nuclear program.
title: Israel warns residents of Tehran to evacuate

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Jim Himes (D-Conn.), the top Democrat on the House Intelligence Committee, scoffed at President Trump’s claims of success following U.S. strikes on three Iranian nuclear sites this weekend. In a Sunday interview on CNN’s “State of the Union,” Himes said there’s no way U.S. officials could have enough information yet to make that assessment.…
title: House Democrat: Trump claims Iran strikes were successful ‘insane’

author: Julia Shapero
description: Hackers aligned with Iran have claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on President Trump’s Truth Social platform, according to the cyber nonprofit Center for Internet Security (CIS). The Iran-aligned hacking group 313 Team took credit for a distributed denial of service (DDos) attack on Truth Social within hours of U.S. strikes on several Iranian nuclear facilities…
title: Iranian-aligned hackers claim responsibility for Truth Social cyberattack

author: Steven Lubet, opinion contributor
description: The Trump administration will likely lose those cases, thanks to the strong American tradition of jury resistance.
title: History shows prosecuting officials challenging ICE raids won’t be easy

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: CNN’s Anderson Cooper and other network correspondents evacuated to a bomb shelter overnight Sunday while reporting from Tel Aviv amid Israel’s ongoing war with Iran. “We’re now hearing an alert,” CNN chief international correspondent Clarissa Ward said on air as alarms interrupted her reporting from an Israeli rooftop. “It’s a 10-minute warning of incoming missiles…
title: Anderson Cooper, CNN crew evacuate while on air in Israel

author: Laura Kelly
description: Pakistan on Sunday condemned U.S. strikes against Iran, one day after Islamabad announced it had nominated President Trump for a Nobel Peace Prize for his mediation of a ceasefire between Pakistan and India last month.  Pakistan said the U.S. attacks violated norms of international law and voiced support for Iran’s right to retaliate in self-defense. …
title: Pakistan nominates Trump for Nobel Peace Prize, then condemns strikes on Iran

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence praised the Trump administration for carrying out surprise strikes against Iran's nuclear facilities and argued that Iran building a nuclear weapon should be "intolerable".
title: Pence: Trump, national security team did what ‘needed to be done’ on Iran

author: Saul Elbein
description: A far-reaching Texas bill signed by Gov. Greg Abbott (R) on Sunday will force manufacturers of processed foods and drinks to put warning labels on any products containing 44 different food additives or dyes believed to be toxic to human health. While the law, which aligns with the “Make America Healthy Again” goals of Health and Human…
title: Abbott signs MAHA measure requiring food warning labels in Texas

author: Laura Kelly
description: The top Democrat on the House Armed Services Committee slammed President Trump’s remarks about regime change in Tehran in the aftermath of U.S. strikes against Iranian nuclear facilities. Rep. Ro Khanna (D-Calif.) said during an interview on CNN U.S. needs to send a clear signal that Washington is not seeking war.  “I mean, just while…
title: Trump ‘joking around about regime change in Iran ‘not funny’: Khanna

author: Svante Myrick, opinion contributor
description: We have seen that resistance can work.
title: ‘No Kings’ was just the start of America’s fight for democracy

author: Henry Rosoff
description: The poll was conducted June 18-20, meaning any developments over the weekend — like former President Bill Clinton endorsing Cuomo — would not have been a factor for voters surveyed.
title: Mamdani ahead of Cuomo in ranked choice voting: NYC mayoral poll

author: Rachel Frazin
description: In the wake of the U.S. attack on Iranian nuclear facilities, President Trump on Monday urged “everyone” to keep oil prices down. “EVERYONE, KEEP OIL PRICES DOWN. I’M WATCHING! YOU’RE PLAYING RIGHT INTO THE HANDS OF THE ENEMY. DON’T DO IT!” Trump said on Truth Social. Oil is traded on a global market, and the…
title: Trump in wake of Iran attack: ‘Everyone, keep oil prices down’

author: Ella Lee
description: The Supreme Court on Monday declined to order a lower court to reconsider its revival of a legal challenge brought by billionaire Elon Musk’s Tesla to a Louisiana law prohibiting car manufacturers from directly selling to consumers.  Louisiana sought another shot at convincing the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit that Tesla’s lawsuit…
title: Supreme Court won’t weigh Louisiana direct sales ban challenged by Tesla

author: Rachel Frazin
description: Oil prices in recent days have hit their highest point in months amid the escalations between the U.S. and Iran. The price of U.S. benchmark WTI crude oil was around $74 per barrel on Monday morning following the weekend U.S. attack on Iran’s nuclear facilities. Late last week, prices rose as high as $77 per…
title: Oil prices up amid Iran conflict

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Sunday urged China to intervene to prevent Iran from closing the Strait of Hormuz, which is one of the most important shipping routes for the world. In an interview on Fox News Channel’s “Sunday Morning Futures,” host Maria Bartiromo asked Rubio whether he expected Iran to close the Strait…
title: US asks China to stop Iran from closing Strait of Hormuz

author: Dustin Lattimer
description: The body of a 12-year-old boy who was killed after being hit by a train in Kansas last week has been found.
title: Body of 12-year-old train victim found by fisherman in Kansas

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Israel bombed Iran's Fordow nuclear bunker site again after the U.S.'s surprise strike on the secretive underground facility over the weekend, while the IAEA said the bombing likely caused significant damage but called for inspections to assess the full scope.
title: Iran state media: Fordow nuclear site struck again

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: The idea of Black New Yorkers giving support to Mamdani because of his opposition to Israel is, well, bizarre.
title: Are Blacks and American Jews still political allies?

description: The Trump administration is expressing confidence that Saturday’s bombings of nuclear sites in Iran did the job of dismantling Tehran’s nuclear ambitions. “This strike on Saturday did make our homeland safer because it took away Iran’s ability to create a nuclear bomb. This is a regime that threatens ‘death to America,’ and ‘death to Israel,…
title: Live updates: White House confident Iran strikes decimated nuclear sites

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump insisted late Sunday that Iran’s nuclear sites have been destroyed, disputing Tehran’s messaging that the Fordow site was not demolished. “Monumental Damage was done to all Nuclear sites in Iran, as shown by satellite images. Obliteration is an accurate term! The white structure shown is deeply imbedded into the rock, with even its…
title: Trump: ‘Obliteration is an accurate term’ for damage to nuclear sites in Iran

author: Jared Gans
description: The Maine Democratic Party has launched a website targeting Republican Sen. Susan Collins (Maine) for votes she they say have caused a significant rollback in abortion rights.  The release of the website, shared exclusively with The Hill, comes ahead of the third anniversary of the Supreme Court’s 2022 ruling in Dobbs v. Jackson Women’s Health…
title: Maine Dems launch website targeting Collins over abortion ahead of Dobbs anniversary

description: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was mistakenly deported by the Trump administration to El Salvador then returned to the U.S. amid a legal battle, was ordered released from jail on Sunday by a Tennessee judge while he awaits federal trial. The government, however, is expected to quickly detain him upon his release, which U.S. Magistrate Judge…
title: Judge orders Abrego Garcia’s release, but government expected to detain him
